metadata.title: CVE-2021-3345 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - high
metadata.description:
_gcry_md_block_write in cipher/hash-common.c in Libgcrypt version 1.9.0 hasa heap-based buffer overflow when the digest final function sets a largecount value. It is recommended to upgrade to 1.9.1 or later.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3345` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgcrypt20 - 1.8.5-5ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libgcrypt20 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.8.5-5ubuntu1').
